intro: Heterosmilax arisanensis, commonly known as the Arisan arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often arrow-shaped. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
